com.gembox.spreadsheet

Class CustomFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gembox.spreadsheet.Filter
      • com.gembox.spreadsheet.CustomFilter

  • public final class CustomFilter
extends Filter
    Represents a filter that specifies one or two conditions (operators and values) and whether the two conditions are joined by 'and' or 'or'.
    See Also:
    AutoFilter for examples which show various ways to specify and apply a filter to a range of cells, Excel AutoFiltering example

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Optional<Boolean> getAnd()
      Gets the value indicating whether the two conditions have an "and" relationship.
      FilterType getFilterType()
      Gets the FilterType.CUSTOM value.

      Gets the operator used by the (first) filter condition.
      FilterOperator getOperator2()
      Gets the operator used by the second filter condition.

      Gets the value used by the (first) filter condition.

      Gets the value used by the second filter condition.

    • Method Detail

      • getAnd

        public Optional<Boolean> getAnd()
        Gets the value indicating whether the two conditions have an "and" relationship. true indicates "and", false indicates "or" and Optional.empty() indicates that second condition won't be applied.
        Returns:
        The value indicating whether the two conditions have an "and" relationship.

      • getFilterType

        public FilterType getFilterType()
        Gets the FilterType.CUSTOM value.

        Returns:

      • setAnd

        public void setAnd(Optional<Boolean> and)
        Sets the value indicating whether the two conditions have an "and" relationship. true indicates "and", false indicates "or" and Optional.empty() indicates that second condition won't be applied.
        Parameters:
        and - The value indicating whether the two conditions have an "and" relationship.

      • setValue

        public void setValue(Object value)

        Sets the value used by the (first) filter condition.

        The value's type must be supported in ExcelCell value (null and types supported in ExcelFile.supportsType(Class)).

        Parameters:
        value - The value used by the (first) filter condition.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - Value's type is not supported.

      • setValue2

        public void setValue2(Object value)

        Sets the value used by the second filter condition.

        The value's type must be supported in ExcelCell vlaue (null and types supported in ExcelFile.supportsType(Class)).

        Parameters:
        value - The value used by the second filter condition.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - Value's type is not supported.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns a String that represents this CustomFilter instance.

        This method should be used primarily for debugging purposes and should be considered volatile (format of its return value might change in future versions).
